Class DoctorService

java.lang.Object
services.DoctorService
public class DoctorService extends Object
This class provides services related to the doctor's operations, including managing medical records, appointments, and schedules. It facilitates viewing and updating patient information, managing appointment timeslots, and handling prescriptions.

The DoctorService class allows the doctor to interact with patient data, view and modify their medical records, manage their daily schedule, and handle appointment requests and updates.

Since:
2024-11-15
Version:
1.0
Author:
LI LIYI

  • Method Details

    • loadDoctorInfo

      public void loadDoctorInfo(String hospitalId) throws IOException
      Loads the doctor's information based on the provided hospital ID.
      Parameters:
      hospitalId - The hospital ID to identify the doctor.
      Throws:
      IOException - If there is an issue retrieving the doctor's information from the repository.

    • viewPatientList

      public void viewPatientList(Scanner scanner) throws IOException
      Displays the list of patients under the doctor's care and allows the doctor to select a patient for further actions.
      Parameters:
      scanner - The scanner object used for user input.
      Throws:
      IOException - If there is an issue retrieving patient data.

    • displayUpdatePatientMenu

      public void displayUpdatePatientMenu(Patient patient, Scanner scanner) throws IOException
      Displays and updates a patient's medical records.
      Parameters:
      patient - The patient whose records need to be updated.
      scanner - The scanner object used for user input.
      Throws:
      IOException - If there is an issue retrieving or updating the patient's medical records.

    • viewSchedule

      public void viewSchedule(Scanner scanner) throws IOException
      Displays and manages the doctor's schedule for a specific date or the next available days.
      Parameters:
      scanner - The scanner object used for user input.
      Throws:
      IOException - If there is an issue retrieving the doctor's schedule from the repository.

    • viewSchedule

      public void viewSchedule(Scanner scanner, LocalDate dateSelected) throws IOException
      Displays and manages the doctor's schedule for a specific date, allowing the doctor to view, approve/decline appointments, or add/remove time slots.
      Parameters:
      scanner - The scanner object used for user input.
      dateSelected - The specific date to view the schedule for (optional).
      Throws:
      IOException - If there is an issue retrieving the doctor's schedule from the repository.

    • displayRemoveTimeSlot

      public void displayRemoveTimeSlot(List<Appointment> schedule, LocalDate selectedDate, Scanner scanner) throws IOException
      Displays a menu to remove an existing timeslot from the doctor's schedule. It lists all the free (unoccupied) timeslots for the selected date and allows the user to choose one to remove.
      Parameters:
      schedule - The current schedule of the doctor.
      selectedDate - The date for which a timeslot is being removed.
      scanner - The scanner object used to take user input.
      Throws:
      IOException - If an error occurs while interacting with the appointment repository.

    • displayApprovalOfAppointment

      public void displayApprovalOfAppointment(List<Appointment> schedule, LocalDate selectedDate, Scanner scanner) throws IOException
      Displays a menu for approving or declining pending appointments for a selected date. The user can approve a pending appointment, which will update its status to confirmed, or decline it, which will free up the corresponding timeslot.
      Parameters:
      schedule - The doctor's schedule for the selected date.
      selectedDate - The date for which appointments are being approved or declined.
      scanner - The scanner object used to take user input.
      Throws:
      IOException - If an error occurs while interacting with the appointment repository.

    • displayUpcomingAppointments

      public void displayUpcomingAppointments(Scanner scanner) throws IOException
      Displays the upcoming appointments for the doctor and allows the user to complete the appointment or return to the previous menu.
      Parameters:
      scanner - The scanner object used to take user input.
      Throws:
      IOException - If an error occurs while interacting with the appointment repository.

    • addMedicalRecord

      public void addMedicalRecord(String patientId, Scanner scanner) throws IOException
      Adds a new medical record for a patient by asking the user for diagnosis, treatment, prescription, and the amount to prescribe. This method is called when only the patient ID is provided. It delegates to another method that accepts the appointment and patient ID as parameters.
      Parameters:
      patientId - The ID of the patient for whom the medical record is being created.
      scanner - The scanner object used to take user input.
      Throws:
      IOException - If an error occurs while interacting with the medical record repository.

    • addMedicalRecord

      public void addMedicalRecord(Appointment appointment, Scanner scanner) throws IOException
      Adds a new medical record for a patient by asking the user for diagnosis, treatment, prescription, and the amount to prescribe. This method is called when an appointment is provided.
      Parameters:
      appointment - The appointment associated with the patient (if available).
      scanner - The scanner object used to take user input.
      Throws:
      IOException - If an error occurs while interacting with the medical record repository.

    • addMedicalRecord

      public void addMedicalRecord(Appointment appointment, Scanner scanner, String patientId) throws IOException
      Adds a new medical record for a patient by asking the user for diagnosis, treatment, prescription, and the amount to prescribe. This method is the core method for creating a medical record and it is called when both the appointment and patient ID are available. It also handles user input for the prescription and ensures the inputs are valid before proceeding.
      Parameters:
      appointment - The appointment associated with the patient (optional, may be null).
      scanner - The scanner object used to take user input.
      patientId - The ID of the patient for whom the medical record is being created.
      Throws:
      IOException - If an error occurs while interacting with the medical record repository.
